title: Azalea
summary: Azaleas /əˈzeɪliə/ are flowering  shrubs in the genus Rhododendron, particularly the former  sections Tsutsuji (evergreen) and Pentanthera (deciduous). Azaleas bloom in the spring (May and June in the temperate Northern Hemisphere, and December and January in the Southern Hemisphere),[1] their flowers often lasting several weeks. Shade tolerant, they prefer living near or under trees. They are part of the family Ericaceae.
